alert.note: Alert for Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 28 at 5:27AM EST until December 28 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Neshaminy Creek At Langhorne affecting Bucks County. For the Neshaminy Creek...including Langhorne...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neshaminy Creek at Langhorne. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Water begins to overflow the lowest banks, on both sides of the creek, into adjacent wooded areas. At 9.0 feet, Flooding begins on Bridle Drive in Middletown Township. At 10.5 feet, Route 413, near Bridgeton Pike in Middletown Township, is subject to closures due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 AM EST Thursday the stage was 9.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:15 AM EST Thursday was 9.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.6 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.5 feet on 10/01/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Stg Time Date Neshaminy Creek Langhorne 9.0 9.2 Thu 5 am 4.5 3.1 10.6 7am 12/28 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 500 PM EST.
